text: out of a hundred and sixty-two countries
I've been to it's right here in Pakistan
that I find to be the absolute cheapest
over the last 13 days traveling from big
cities to small towns and rural villages
I just cannot believe how affordable
this country is travel expenses can
always be broken down into three main
categories accommodation transportation
and food let's take a deeper look at
each hotels for a whopping $8 a night
you can get a room like this hot water
Wi-Fi comfortable bed and AC and you can
pay for it without cash using easy paisa
transportation using uber is the most
efficient way to get around the big
cities what's up man and it cost about
$2 for every 10 kilometers on the other
hand rickshaws are 30 cents per 2
kilometers and buses only 10 cents for
up to 30 kilometers it will never break
your bank account to get around Pakistan
let's talk about food biryani 70 cents
tikka chicken 60 cents icecream
50 cent a delicious salad 40 cents and
lasse for 30 cents basically what I'm
trying to say is that if you have $10
you can cover all your meals for a week
but the best part about traveling in
Pakistan is that you likely won't have
to pay for anything as soon as someone
finds out that your guests scratch that
it's actually free because he won't take
the money right and sure why is it free
wild
yes because I'm a guest guest thank you
I've never been treated with this amount
of generosity by more people in my life
thank you as immature above anything
else I will remember Pakistan for its
hospitality the prices are just an added
bonus for why this country is one of my
favorites it's a cherry on top so
whenever someone asked me what is the
cheapest country I now have a new answer
visit Pakistan it's cheaper than you
think
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
